content:
I’m a third-year Electronics and Computer Engineering undergraduate student at Thapar University, Patiala, India. My research focus is broadly centered around Computer Vision and Deep Learning. I work on research projects dealing with Generative Adversarial Networks, Knowledge Distillation, and zero-shot classificatiom. I intend to explore deep model under low-resource training data scenario using semi-supervised and self-supervised paradigm.
I have worked as a Research Intern at SketchX Labs and Inception Institute of Artificial Intelligence. I have also worked as a part-time Research Engineerat a startup Minus Zero where I worked on an autonomous electric car with level 5 autonomy.
News  [June 2021] Got selected for Weights & Biases Machine Learning Reproducibility Challenge, Spring 2021 Grant. [June 2021] Got selected for Prairie/MIAI Summer School 2021, INRIA. [May 2021] Volunteered for the ICLR Conference 2021. [June 2020] Got selected for Gaussian Process Summer School 2020, Sheffield University. [September 2020] Won Bronze Metal for Kaggle Notebook in I’m Something of a Painter Myself challenge. [July 2020] Top 42% Worldwide in Google Landmark Recognition 2020.
summary: I’m a third-year Electronics and Computer Engineering undergraduate student at Thapar University, Patiala, India. My research focus is broadly centered around Computer Vision and Deep Learning. I work on research projects dealing with Generative Adversarial Networks, Knowledge Distillation, and zero-shot classificatiom.
title: Animesh Gupta

summary: An Open Source Zero Shot classification toolbox based on PyTorch.
title: ZSl Generative

summary: TF-VAEGAN proposes to enforce a semantic embedding decoder (SED) at training, feature synthesis and classification stages of (generalized) zero-shot learning.
title: [Re] Latent Embedding Feedback and Discriminative Featuresfor Zero-Shot Classification (Under Review)

summary: Developed a GAN that generates 7,000 to 10,000 Monet-style images.
title: I’m Something of a Painter Myself

summary: Developed a classification model for predicting seven emotions like (angry, disgusted,fearful, happy, neutral, sad and surprised) using FER-2013 dataset.
title: AI for Blind

summary: Developed a classification model for predicting landmark labels using the GLDv2 dataset.
title: Google Landmark Recognition 2020

summary: "Programmer” is more closely associated with “man” and “homemaker” is more closely associated with “woman”. Such gender bias has also been shown to propagate in downstream tasks.
title: [Re] Double-Hard Debias: Tailoring Word Embeddings for Gender Bias Mitigation
